title: â€˜Is #MerylStreepForPresident Trending Yet?â€™: Twitter Reacts to Meryl Streepâ€™s Golden Globes Speech
text:
â€” Richard Grenell (@RichardGrenell) January 9, 2017 And I love the super classy responses from the left who immediately and ironically cry on Twitter about me being silent. I'll get louder. 
â€” Dana Loesch (@DLoesch) January 9, 2017 This is exactly why Hwood is DYING, what a bunch of hypocrites. Sex, violence, and drivel rule hwood. Turning the channel. https://t.co/jZVRviw7jw 
â€” Sean Hannity (@seanhannity) January 9, 2017 Q: Did #MerylStreep lecture Hillary for referring to disabled kids as "fâ€”â€“g retards"? https://t.co/626WYI3KzL #GoldenGlobes 
â€” Larry Elder (@larryelder) January 9, 2017 
However, there were quite a few famous folks who seemed genuinely moved and impressed by Streepâ€™s address: #MerylStreep â€œTake your broken heart, turn it into art.â€ #Brilliant #GoldenGlobes 
â€” Don Lemon (@donlemon) January 9, 2017 Next level brilliant ballsy human fearless! #MerylStreep lifetime achievement bravo! Encore! #GoldenGlobes thank you! pic.twitter.com/0SaRePW1a6 
â€” Sandra Bernhard (@SandraBernhard) January 9, 2017 Meryl Streep you gave the most important speech of the past few months,you are our national treasure. Thank you #MerylStreep #hero 
â€” Sebastian RochÃ© (@sebroche) January 9, 2017 As the daughter of foreigners and a member of the press, thank you #MerylStreep 
â€” Maria Elena Salinas (@MariaESalinas) January 9, 2017 Congrats #MerylStreep and thank you for a beautiful speech. Disrespect invites disrespect! Let's spread love. 
â€” Lauren Potter (@TheLaurenPotter) January 9, 2017 I believe we just heard #MerylStreep give one of the most profoundly honest & human speeches ever given at any awards show. #GoldenGlobes 
â€” Craig Zadan (@craigzadan) January 9, 2017 Take your broken heart and turn it into art. I love that! #MerylStreep #GoldenGlobes 
â€” Maria Shriver (@mariashriver) January 9, 2017 "Disrespect invites disrespect, violence incites violence". Well said, #MerylStreep , well said. #GoldenGlobes 
â€” Valerie Bertinelli (@Wolfiesmom) January 9, 2017 Meryl Streep giving an epic and powerful speech at the #GoldenGlobes . ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ» 
â€” Jesse Tyler Ferguson (@jessetyler) January 9, 2017 Meryl Streep you are Hollywood's hero. 
â€” Liz Hernandez (@LizHernandez) January 9, 2017 What a brave and inspirational speech by #MerylStreep on the #GoldenGlobes 
â€” Joan Collins (@Joancollinsdbe) January 9, 2017 #MerylStreep said it better than any of us ever could. The greatest actor of all time. Trump voters can mock art. But art always wins. 
â€” Steve Mason (@VeniceMase) January 9, 2017 #MerylStreep your work, your words.. & your heart is why you are the history lesson our young generation should aspire to be. #GoldenGlobes 
â€” Wilmer Valderrama (@WValderrama) January 9, 2017 
And, of course, liberals chimed in with their love for the speech: "When the powerful use their position to bully others, we all lose"â€” Meryl Streep 
â€” Judd Legum (@JuddLegum) January 9, 2017 Meryl is out here preaching. #GoldenGlobes 
â€” deray mckesson (@deray) January 9, 2017 Yeah, #MerylStreep reminding people it's gross for a presidential candidate to make fun of disabled people is why liberals lost the election 
â€” Reza Aslan (@rezaaslan) January 9, 2017 For anyone who wondered how #MerylStreep could possibly match @violadavis 's incredible introduction to her, now we know. #GoldenGlobes 
â€” Victoria Brownworth (@VABVOX) January 9, 2017 
We got this reaction from the president of GLAAD: My jaw is on the floor. Thank you, Meryl Streep, you gave the speech that needed to be given. #GoldenGlobes 
â€” Sarah Kate Ellis (@sarahkateellis) January 9, 2017 
Others just wanted to know when Trump would react: Countdown to Trump tweeting about Meryl Streep in 5â€¦4â€¦3â€¦ #GoldenGlobes
